text: The Diocese of Montecorvino (Latin: Dioecesis Montis Corbini) was a Roman Catholic diocese located between the towns of Motta Montecorvino and Pietramontecorvino, both in the Province of Foggia. In 1433, it was united with the Diocese of Vulturara to form the Diocese of Vulturara e Montecorvino."Diocese of Montecorvino" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved August 25, 2016"Titular Episcopal See of Montecorvino" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved August 25, 2016 In 1968 it was restored as the Titular Episcopal See of Montecorvino. ==References== Category:Former Roman Catholic dioceses in Italy
title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Montecorvino
